com.emc.esu.api

Class Acl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emc.esu.api.Acl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Grant>

    public class Acl
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Grant>
    An Access Control List (ACL) is a collection of Grants that assign privileges to users and/or groups.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Acl()
      Creates a new access control list

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGrant(Grant g)
      Adds a grant to the access control list
      void clear()
      Clears all the grants in the ACL.

      Returns true if this ACL contains the specified Grant.
      int count() 
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Returns true if the ACLs are equal.
      java.util.Iterator<Grant> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over this ACL's grant objects.
      void removeGrant(Grant g)
      Removes a grant from the access control list.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the ACL's grant set as a String.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns true if the ACLs are equal. This is done by ensuring they have the same number of grants and each ACL contains the same set of grants.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the ACL's grant set as a String.

        Returns true if this ACL contains the specified Grant.

        Returns:
        true if this ACL contains the grant.
